page.title: 03THE GAMEKEEPERS YEAR CONT.
page.content: marks them with a dye,which is a different colour from the ones used by neighbouring shepherds. At the same time he mends hill roads, clears drains and mends grouse butts,which are made of tufts of grass, peat, wood and heather. From{12th August until 10th {September}Mr Reid goes grouse-shooting every day except Sunday. Each morning at seven o'clock he is at the lodge, cleaning the guns, and filling the leather cartridge-cases with cartridges. This has to be done before the tenants of the lodge are ready to go out shooting. He takes the shooting party, any number from three to nine, up the hill in his land-rover. When they reach the butts,the party starts
